# `gerp`: Good Enuff R Practices

<!-- badges: start -->
<!-- badges: end -->

The goal of `gerp` is to get you up and running with '[good enough R  practices!](https://journals.plos.org/ploscompbiol/article?id=10.1371/journal.pcbi.1005510)'

## Installation

You can install the development version of `gerp` like so:

``` r
install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("mjfrigaard/gerp")
```

## Example

Create a new `ger` project:

```{r example, eval=FALSE}
library(gerp)
ger::ger_proj(parent_dir = "/Users/mjfrigaard/", 
  proj_name = "my new project")
```

```{r gerp-new-proj, echo=FALSE, eval=TRUE}
knitr::include_graphics("man/figures/gerp-new-proj.gif")
```

Run `ger::ger_setup()` and start working! 

```{r gerp-setup, echo=FALSE, eval=TRUE}
knitr::include_graphics("man/figures/gerp-setup.gif")
```
